name: Seattle Integrated Martial Arts
details: Seattle Integrated Martial Arts is a multi-disciplined, mixed martial arts school. Through our association with Guro Dan Inosanto, our roots are in Bruce Lee's Jeet Kune Do training and philosophy. We believe that cross training the various  martial arts we teach opens the student's mind and nurtures an adaptable martial artist. Different training methods enhance different physical and mental attributes. For example, the double stick work from Kali (Filipino Martial Arts) enhances perceptual speed and coordination, the pad work from Muay Thai Kickboxing gives us a powerful striking base while providing an amazing cardio workout, the study of Jiu-jitsu teaches intricate problem solving while dealing with real pressure and full body engagement. This is just a small example of the benefits of martial arts cross training but is the underlying concept of the SIMA program and an important principle of the JKD philosophy. Cross-training in all disciplines is highly encouraged but not required.  We have classes that combine arts (Kali/JKD and IMA), as well as classes that focus on one area (Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, Muay Thai Kickboxing, and Self-Defense).

kids_program_detail: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu (BJJ) is a strategic, relatively nonviolent method of self-defense.  It utilizes leverage, locks and holds that can neutralize a bigger, stronger opponent. The student will know what is on the test and will practice the necessary techniques in the weeks leading up to the test. Click here to learn how to tie your BJJ belt! Once students are about 15 years old, they will graduate into the adult Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu program.  BJJ is a martial art the can be practiced throughout life. name: Integrated Martial Arts of Utah
details: Our martial arts gym in Murray, UT specializes in the Bihonte (Bee-hon-te) Combativos System, which is a composite group of highly effective developed martial arts systems that combine to form a unique system of martial arts. The Bihonte system has as its core, five unique martial arts systems that each focus on various aspects of hand-to-hand combat. These five systems include Mokuraiken Kempo which is emphasized by lightning fast strikes and low kicks, Jeet Kune Do (Bruce Lee’s method of kickboxing and Wing Chun), ShihKeafma (Filipino Stick and Blade Arts), & Brazilian Jiu-jitsu/BJJ (specifically Pedro Sauer Gracie Jujitsu), and Hai Ki Chi Do (stand up Jiu-Jitsu), each of which was developed and practiced by various martial arts masters and founders who sought to develop one highly effective martial arts system that would incorporate and complement each of the individual systems and yet allow for effective fighting methods which incorporated a blend of striking, kicking, throwing, take downs, submissions, grappling, conditioning, joint locks, individual weapons training, and weapon disarmament. In addition to martial arts training the 54th Street Gym offers Fusion Fit training for men and women which is a unique form of heavy punching bag, focus mitt, thai pad, belly pad, shadow boxing, and plyometrics designed to use the body’s own natural weight for conditioning. It is an excellent way to get in shape, stay in shape, or improve your shape.
kids_program_detail: Looking for a fun, exciting activity for your kids? Check out our kid’s martial arts in Murray, UT! Our children’s martial arts classes draw upon the same great sources for striking, kicking, grappling, and self-defense as our adult classes, but provide that training in a single, integrated format designed specifically for a younger audience. Students will learn grappling from Brazilian Jiu-jitsu, striking from Muay Thai, Kickboxing, Taekwondo, Kempo and Kali, along with self-defense courses, and anti-bullying skills, all in a format that is fun and safe for kids of all ages. We have several programs for kids. Beginners and Advanced as well as a class that is actually done with the parents if they choose to participate. The Beginner Kid’s/Jr. Grappler’s class is for kids that are 7-15 years of age and who have never done any martial arts classes. Verbal assertiveness strategies are a major portion of this curriculum. A child needs absolutely no experience to start, and we guarantee a noticeable increase in your child’s confidence within a few weeks! In addition to the Gracie Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu, we teach the kids a combination of punching, kicking and simple self-defense skills. The other group is the Kids Advanced for kids 7-15 that have achieved at least a gold belt rank and above. If your child trained in another martial art they may be allowed to participate in this class after an initial assessment period. We want to make sure that every student has a good foundation to allow them to progress with the other kids in the class. Kids in this martial arts class will engage in controlled sparring and grappling. The parent/child class is for kids 4-7. It is done once a week and is often done with the parent so that the parents can work with the child thru the week. We teach the kids basic self-defense techniques while instilling the foundational principles of leverage and control. Numerous school districts have embraced the defensive nature of the Gracie Bullyproof techniques as a reasonable, nonviolent response to bullying and some even host Gracie Bullyproof classes on campus! The bottom line is: we will prepare your child to defend themselves against bullies without turning them into one. If you’re interested in instilling your child with unshakable confidence while reinforcing positive values and good character, the Gracie Bullyproof program is for you! name: Gracie Milwaukee
details: While many self-defense systems come and go, a good self-defense strategy (which is rooted in science) will last a lifetime. Rather than focusing on short term solutions like strength, fitness, power and speed to defend against a bigger, stronger, more athletic attacker, Gracie Jiu-Jitsu employs techniques that rely on proper timing and maximum leverage to help you get out of harms way. Fast. This strategy or “philosophy” translates throughout every single movement, action and technique in Gracie Jiu-Jitsu and has proven itself effective in all areas of human combat over the last 85 years.
kids_program_detail: The goal of the Gracie Bullyproof program is to instill in your child unshakable confidence so they can overcome bullies without violence. Due to the non-violent nature of the techniques, CNN, ABC, NBC, and Oprah have featured the Gracie Bullyproof program as one of the few effective counter-measures to bullying for children between the ages of 7 and 13. We will teach your child to use verbal assertiveness to deter bullies and several non-violent self-defense techniques to stay safe if physically assaulted. Importantly, we don’t teach how to punch or kick, since this often does more harm than good. Instead, we use leverage-based control holds to neutralize threats without violence. Numerous school districts have embraced the defensive nature of the Gracie Bullyproof techniques as a reasonable, nonviolent response to bullying and some even host Gracie Bullyproof classes on campus! The bottom line is: we will prepare your child to defend themselves against bullies without turning them into one.
woman_only_program_detail: Women Empowered is the official Gracie self-defense program for women. In this 10 lesson program, we will teach you how to neutralize the 15 most common attacks ranging from having your hair grabbed to being pinned to the ground by a weapon-bearing assailant. Each one-hour Women Empowered lesson addresses two techniques. You can start the program at any time and participate in any class without previous experience. Unlike most self-defense systems that rely heavily on strength, speed, and coordination, the techniques in the Women Empowered program employ leverage, technique, and timing, so anyone, regardless of age or athletic ability, can make them work against larger opponents. Once you complete the Women Empowered program, you may test for promotion to Pink Belt!If you have no previous martial arts experience and you want to learn how to defend yourself in a fun, safe, and cooperative learning environment, Women Empowered is for you. Law enforcement officials and survivors of sexual assault helped us identify the 15 most common attack strategies that a male assailant is likely to use on a woman. From hair-grabs and choke-holds, to bear hugs and weapon defenses, the Women Empowered program covers it all.

When teaching kids class, Professor Raths uses fun games and an easy teaching style to instill the fundamental techniques into his students. Why Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ)? Brazilian Jiu Jitsu provides many benefits to children that continue through their lives. Problem-solving skills: Every class students are faced with new problems and situations, be it a new technique or simply a new partner. The constant change and application of knowledge learned is a great way to sharpen young developing minds. Discipline: Having the structure, respect, and discipline that BJJ provides translates well into all aspects of life, from school to home life. Physical Fitness: Another benefit to children who train BJJ that is often overlooked is the fitness aspect. During class, BJJ is sure to work your body as much as your mind. Social Benefits: On the mats, all students are equal, no matter what. This allows for the trust and dedication required to practice a martial art. BJJ brings together groups that may not have met any other way- leading to a diverse and beneficial social experience. Self Defense: Unfortunately, in today's world, it is a reality that being able to defend yourself is a benefit. At Groundwork Grappling, one of our primary lessons for all students is that we should never escalate or use force if there is a way to defuse the situation, however if it is necessary, we want our students to be able to defend themselves effectively and efficiently. At some point, most physical altercations end up on the ground- which is where Brazilian Jiu Jitsu is most useful.

name: Maverick Training Center - Atos Jiu Jitsu Huntsville
details: Maverick started in 2003 in the aerobics room of a local fitness gym.  What started out as fitness boxing classes for a few people quickly transformed into a small, dedicated group of students who were interested in learning Boxing, Muay Thai and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu. At this time Suzanne was training with Richard Bustillo and Helio Soneca, and bringing them both down to Huntsville to teach seminars in their respective arts. Over time, mostly through word of mouth, class sizes continued to grow.  Maverick then went from being a small club in a fitness gym to being one of the most recognizable and successful gyms in the Southeast. Though Maverick has grown, we have maintained the same small gym community atmosphere that we believe separates us from the rest. In 2016, Maverick joined the Atos Jiu-Jitsu Association under multiple time World Champion Andre Galvao and and is located in historic downtown Huntsville.

details: My name is Master Tom Mullaney and I am the Senior Instructor teaching our Taekwondo and Jiu-Jitsu classes in a one of kind family friendly and cooperative training environment. Deciding to train in a martial arts program can be scary and cause you to consider giving up before you ever really get started.  My family and I experienced the same fears and questions many years ago when we began our journey.  We have been blessed in our martial arts career to train directly under the founder of our Taekwondo system Grandmaster Man Hee Han and have the privilege and opportunity to learn the style, techniques and philosophies directly from him and his son Master Yujin Han. When I started studying martial arts my daughters and eventually my wife joined with me. We have some of our most memorable trips and adventures because of this journey that we started and share together. We learn together, practicing at home together, and preparing each other for belt tests and competitions. There are a lot of families in our martial arts organization that study and train together. I would have never dreamed that all these years later I would be a Master Instructor and operate Academies teaching others martial arts and encouraging men, women and entire families to begin the same journey I began so many years before.  Many years after beginning my training with Grandmaster Han I was looking to diversify my training and add more opportunities in our Academy.  It was at this time that I was blessed for the second time in my training career.  I began training in Gracie Jiu-Jitsu under Grandmaster Rorion Gracie and his two sons Professors Ryron and Rener who are the son and grandsons of the creator of Gracie Jiu-Jitsu, Grandmaster Helio Gracie. To say that I have been blessed and fortunate to train under two of the greatest martial arts families in history would be an understatement. By beginning your journey with us either in Youn Wha Ryu Taekwondo or Gracie Jiu-Jitsu you can guarantee that you are learning the lessons and techniques exactly in the manner in which the Grandmasters intended them to be learned!
kids_program_detail: Every month in the United States, three million children miss school due to fear of bullies. In the Gracie Bullyproof program, our goal is to instill in your child unshakable confidence so they can overcome bullies without violence. Due to the non-violent nature of the techniques, CNN, ABC, NBC, and Oprah have featured the Gracie Bullyproof program as one of the few effective counter-measures to bullying for children between the ages of 5 and 13. We will teach your child to use verbal assertiveness to deter bullies and several non-violent self-defense techniques to stay safe if physically assaulted. Importantly, we don’t teach how to punch or kick, since this often does more harm than good. Instead, we use leverage-based control holds to neutralize threats without violence. Numerous school districts have embraced the defensive nature of the Gracie Bullyproof techniques as a reasonable, nonviolent response to bullying and some even host Gracie Bullyproof classes on campus! The bottom line is: we will prepare your child to defend themselves against bullies without turning them into one. If you’re interested in instilling your child with unshakable confidence while reinforcing positive values and good character, the Gracie Bullyproof program is for you! We are the ONLY Certified Training Center in Central Arkansas trained and authorized to offer your children this opportunity.
